newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Great Eagle trades up after spin-off news.
newsitem.headline: Great Eagle trades up after spin-off news.

text.p: Shares of Great Eagle Holdings Ltd traded higher on Monday on news that it would spin off its Tai Shan Properties unit.
After forty-five minutes, Great Eagle shares were up 60 cents at HK$32.00.
The investment holding and property development firm announced earlier that it planned to raise up to HK$2.5 billion by spinning off its Tai Shan Properties Ltd unit.
The move was widely expected by the market.
Geoff Galbraith, institutional sales trader at Nava SC Securities said: "I think it is probably factored into the price."

Shares in Tai Shan would be offered in a Hong Kong public offering and also to international professional and institutional investors in Hong Kong, the United States and elsewhere, Great Eagle said in a statement.
Following the Tai Shan offer, Great Eagle said it would own 73.15 percent of the unit.
